value: There is beauty to be seen in Dutchess County in every season: A frozen waterfall of Wappinger Creek
. The closest major airport is across the river from
, but at present offers few direct flights to major destinations.
. Two counties away, but an alternative to the congestion of the 3 major international airports around New York City. Rental cars available.
: Livery cars offer service to and from 3 major international airports. Metro-North Railroad and Amtrak offer rail links to Dutchess County.

and the I90 east-west portion of the Thruway system to
via the Saw Mill River and the Henry Hudson Parkways.

. There is service between New York City's Grand Central Terminal and Pawling, Appalachian Trail flag stop (limited service, but convenient for hikers), Harlem Valley-Wingdale, Dover Plains, Tenmile River, and Wassaic. On-board train fares are subject to a stiff surcharge, so buy your tickets at the station or at the vending machines located on the platform.
.  Runs on the Hudson River side of the county. Long distance connections are available at Metro-North's Poughkeepsie station.
name=Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library & Museum
. This is the first presidential library, and to date the only one used by its namesake while in office. Museum hours 9AM-5PM daily November-April; 9AM-6PM May-October.

content=Route 9G, Hyde Park. The only National Historic Site dedicated to a First Lady. Val-Kill is a modest home and it is the only one that was Eleanor's alone. House open daily May through October, 9AM-5PM. House is closed for renovation until August 2006, but grounds are open.
name=Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt National Historic Site
content=Albany Post Rd (Route 9), Hyde Park. Open year round, daily. Closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Years Day. Buildings are open 9AM-5PM, grounds are open 7AM to sunset.
content=(Route 9), Hyde Park. A magnificent mansion from the gilded age, set on 212 acres overlooking the Hudson River.
. Museum for the Dia Art Foundation's collection of modern art, including works by Andy Warhol. Located in a 300,000 square foot historic factory on 31 acres of riverfront. Summer hours Th-M 11AM-6PM
. Adults $10, students and seniors $7, children under 12 free. Free admission for Dia members.
. Stunning Queen Anne style mansion set on park-like grounds designed by Calvert Vaux. Open May-October, Th-Su noon-4PM.

content=Tyrrel Rd, Millbrook. 150 acre garden open to the public. Chinese landscape design incorporates streams, waterfalls, rocks, and plants. Center piece is the 40 acre glacial lake. Open May 7-October 20. W, Th, F, 10AM-4 PM; Sa, Su, and legal holidays, 11AM-5PM. Closed M and Tu except legal holidays. W, Th and F: $4/person 4 and older. Sa, Su, and legal holidays: $5/person 4 and older. No pets.

state is one of the larger wine producing states in the
. The Hudson Valley is one of five production regions within the state, and Dutchess County produces some of the best wine in the area. Follow the trail and taste the produce of four wineries.

value: . Tours and tastings from mid-April through December, Sa-Su 11AM-5PM. Views of the

content=Clinton Corners. Specializes in the Seyval Blanc grape. One of the few wineries in the region that produces sparkling wines fermented in the bottle, and has a line of dessert wines from specialty fruit. Tours and tasting Th-M 11AM-6PM (Winter: F-S Noon-4:30PM).

content=Millbrook. Renowned winery with a long list of awards for its wines. 130 acres with 30 planted to grapes. The winery itself is located in a renovated dairy barn that has great views of the rolling hills of Dutchess County and of the
across the Hudson River. The proprietors also own two wineries in
. Guided tours and tastings year round, 7 days a week, S-Sa 12PM-5PM. From Memorial Day through Labor Day S-Sa 11AM-6PM.

content=Millerton. Harney & Sons is a supplier of fine tea to renowned restaurants and hotels. The company headquarters and distribution center is on the outskirts of the village and it operates a tea shop and tasting room on Main Street. Visit the tasting room for a perfect cup of tea. The staff is courteous and graciously shares their vast knowledge of tea.
content=Rt. 44, Millerton. Library, fireplace, dining, wine cellar.

County wide 911 system for summoning emergency assistance. Dutchess County encompasses some of the safest areas in the United States and is a safe place to visit.
Most of the county is in telephone area code 845. The northeastern portion of the county uses the 518 area code.
